  • Method Details

    • isAdmin

      public boolean isAdmin() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks whether the current user has administrator privileges
      Returns:
      true if it's the case, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - On database access error

    • setAdmin

      public void setAdmin​(int diskLimit) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method should only be called at the first boot It should be used to set the first user to sign up as the system's administrator
      Parameters:
      diskLimit - (Only parameter for now) Memory usage limit to be applied to all users in bytes
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - When a database access error occurs

    • setLimit

      public void setLimit​(long value) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Sets the disk usage limit value
      Parameters:
      value - The limit value
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - On database access error

    • addUser

      public int addUser​(java.lang.String fName, java.lang.String lName, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Adds a user to the database
      Parameters:
      fName - First name
      lName - Last name
      userName - User name
      email - email
      password - password
      Returns:
      the unique identifier of the newly inserted user
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs

    • userExists

      public boolean userExists​(java.lang.String userName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Queries the database for the requested userName
      Parameters:
      userName - userName to be searched
      Returns:
      true if found, false if not
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - When a database access error occurs

    • validateData

      public int validateData​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks the validity of the password associated with the username
      Parameters:
      userName - input username
      password - input password
      Returns:
      The unique identifier of the user if the password matches, 0 if the user does not exist, -1 if the data is invalid
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - When a database access error occurs

      Returns:
      True if it's the case, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      id - The user's id
      Returns:
      The user's information the key is the field's name containing fName, lName, email, uName
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs

    • userSettingsSync

      public void userSettingsSync​(User newUser, java.lang.String newPassword) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates the user's information
      Parameters:
      newUser - The new user information. If null, it won't be updated
      newPassword - The new password. If null, the password won't be updated
